backend

Class Request

  • java.lang.Object
    • backend.Request

  • public class Request
extends java.lang.Object
    The Request class is used to create requests for resource copies that have been requested by users. Librarians can then issue a copy that has been requested.

      • Request

        public Request(java.lang.String username,
               int staffID,
               int copyUID,
               java.lang.String dueDate,
               java.lang.String issueDate,
               java.lang.String returnDate)
        Creates a request for a resource copy.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user making the request.
        staffID - The ID of the librarian issuing the copy.
        copyUID - The unique ID of the copy.
        dueDate - The date the copy is due to be returned.
        issueDate - The date the copy was issued.
        returnDate - The date the copy was returned.

    • Method Detail

      • returnCopy

        public static void returnCopy(int copyUID,
                              java.lang.String username)
        Returns an on-loan copy that has been returned by a user.
        Parameters:
        copyUID - Unique ID of the copy that is being returned.
        username - The username of the user returning an on-loan copy.

      • requestCopy

        public static void requestCopy(int copyUID,
                               java.lang.String username,
                               int staffID)
        Requests a copy of a resource for a user, this request needs to verified and allowed by a librarian.
        Parameters:
        copyUID - The unique ID of the resource copy being requested.
        username - The username of the user requesting a resource copy.
        staffID - The staffID of the librarian allowing the request.

      • collectCopy

                               java.lang.String username)

        Parameters:
        copyUID - The unique ID of the resource copy being collected.
        username - The username of the user collecting the resource copy.
